transcription.text: This is Carl. Good afternoon, Carl. This is Jim Lombardo with PC Recruiter. How are you? Who's the name? This is Jim Lombardo with PC Recruiter. And then I moved back to the company I was before, and they used PC Recruiter. But I'm also doing some independent work myself. And I tried a database. I'm not really happy with it. And these would be, you know, my candidates. You know, if I find them on LinkedIn or someplace and they're in my database that I can use for whatever. All the other companies that I work with in C, you just pay a monthly fee. I understand your program pretty well I actually was an administrator for it and the setup fee that you're charging is literally just money just money you guys are going to take there's no setup I don't do it so I don't know what all they need to do they're just charging an extra $200 because they want the money this does look a little bit different I get that, but I'm just an individual. I'm just, you know, I'm willing to pay a monthly fee for it, but to have you pay you for a setup for something that all you really got to do is, it's in the cloud. You create a link. I'm pretty technical, pretty knowledgeable. I've worked with Andrew at your company on a lot of technical things when I was working at my other company. and you're charging for something just because you can. If I can do your list price at 115, I'll do zero setup. Now, we're in the right ballpark. So the PCRM is, it's going to be a whole new interface. So it is going to be, as you're seeing, if you're seeing it on the screen, it doesn't have the menu across the top. menus across the left if you click into any of these screens they're going to look a little bit different they have the same terminology the same names the same tabs but it looks and works a little bit different it adds a deals pipeline so there's like a sales funnel added into there yeah a lot of the terminology is the same like you'll be able to figure it out since you've used us for so long you'll be able to recognize okay roll-ups I know what that is you'll be able to click through and though the screen looks totally different you're going to it's going to make sense you'll see names companies positions you'll be able to figure out the menus and they've actually tried to take PCRM and make it easier for someone just starting out of out of nowhere just to look at it and be able to figure it out the menus are all the same throughout the whole system and it uses the same terminology as does the old PCR 9 so you're going to be pretty familiar with it already so so why um why would somebody say oh I want this instead of your other program what is it what does it give me or listen why why would I want this instead of your other one other than the interface which I like well the biggest two things are going to be that it adds a deals pipeline so it adds that sales funnel that our old version did not have never had so it has a sales funnel it also adds a simpler sequencing tool so you can actually build a sequence on the fly from a roll up list in a couple minutes and launch it so some people like that the sequencing is simpler to use in the pcrm product than it was in the other version and that just the ease of it's a little bit easier configure you can do things like edit in line when you're looking at a list of search results it's easier to contact and send an email or anything like that i think it said it had on natural communication in them too. It does have, so there's some AI pieces in there too. So that's going to give you ability to like do a little content generator. There's an AI search they're working on. There's actually one that was just put in. I haven't even seen it yet. It just was released last week while I was out. And it is like an auto match. So if you have a job opening in PC Recruiter, you can click a button. It'll pull up the closest 15 matches in your database. Ah. job. I love that. That's a nice piece.
